scenarios.title: The Revolutionary Bookmark Placement Theory
scenarios.text:
üìö BOOK LOVERS ALERT! I've discovered something that will revolutionize how you read FOREVER! üìö

I'm Emma, age 14, total bookworm, and I accidentally stumbled upon the most AMAZING reading secret! Last month I was reading Harry Potter (again) and accidentally put my bookmark on page 42 instead of where I actually stopped reading (page 67). When I opened the book the next day, I somehow remembered EVERYTHING that happened between pages 42-67 perfectly, even though I hadn't read it in 3 weeks! I thought it was weird so I tested this 'backward bookmark' technique with 8 different books over a month, and it worked EVERY TIME! My reading comprehension improved by like 200% and I finished books 50% faster! I researched this online and found that speed-reading experts have been using 'retroactive bookmark positioning' for YEARS but keeping it secret because if everyone knew, libraries would go out of business (people would read too fast and need fewer books)! Plus, publishing companies would lose money because readers would finish series too quickly! But I'm torn because this seems too good to be true... Maybe my brain just works differently? Or maybe I'm fooling myself? I mean, how could bookmark placement affect memory? But the results speak for themselves! I want to share this with everyone but I'm scared people will think I'm crazy... Should I start a YouTube channel about 'Revolutionary Reading Techniques'? What if I'm wrong and waste people's time? But what if I'm right and could help millions of students? I'm so confused about what to do! üòÖ
